ESDS Government</AuthEnty>         <othId>The Economic and Social Data Service (ESDS) was funded to compile this teaching dataset by the Economic and Social Research Council (ESRC) and Joint Information Systems Committee (JISC).<br> <br> The Office for National Statistics, Social Survey Division (ONS) funded the main <i>ONS Opinions Survey, Well-Being Module, April, June, July, August and September 2011</i> from which this dataset has been compiled. The depositors would like to thank ONS for their permission to repurpose the data.<br> <br> The dataset was prepared by Necla Acik-Toprak of the Economic and Social Data Service at the Cathie Marsh Centre for Census and Survey Research, University of Manchester.</othId>       </rspStmt>       <prodStmt>         <producer>Office for National Statistics. Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>ONS Opinions Survey, Well-Being Module, April 2011: Unrestricted Access Teaching Dataset</i> is based on the <i>ONS Opinions Survey, Well-Being Module, April, June, July, August and September 2011</i> (available from the UK Data Archive under SN 6893) and constitutes real data which are used by government, business and other organisations. The teaching dataset is a subset which has been subjected to certain simplifications and additions for the purpose of learning and teaching.<br>  <br> The main differences are: <ul><li>the teaching dataset contains data from April 2011 only<li>the number of variables has been reduced<li>a reduced user guide with codebook is provided<li>some variables have been recoded due to concerns about statistical disclosure</li></ul>Further information is available in the study documentation (below) which includes a user guide.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Well-Being (Module MCZ): this module was originally asked on behalf of ONS and questions ask respondents to rate their well-being on a scale of 0-10, where 0 is generally low and 10 high.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd>April 2011</timePrd>         <collDate>April 2011</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Adults, aged 16 or over, living in private households in Great Britain.</universe>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>The <i>Opinions and Lifestyle Survey</i> is a repeated cross-sectional study but this teaching dataset has been compiled using only data from the April 2011 Well-Being Module.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>1,124 (obtained)</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>The data are taken from the <i>ONS Opinions Survey, Well-Being Module, April 2011</i>, which is available from the UK Data Archive under SN 6893.</dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details.</weight>         <cleanOps>A*</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Open</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is not required.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>This unrestricted access teaching dataset is freely available to download under an <a href="http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/2/" title="Open Government Licence">Open Government Licence</a>.</conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relStdy>6297 National Awareness and Early Diagnosis Initiative: Cancer Awareness Measure, 2008 </relStdy>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
